Dear Sheffield City Council,
Can you please provide the number of parking permits currently issued on Harcourt Road, S10 Sheffield.
Please indicate:
1) How many resident's parking permits issued
2) How many visitor permit books

4) The number of houses that have 3 or more residents permits issued.
Yours faithfully,
James Little

Dear James Little,
Thank you for your request for information relating to parking permits, 20
mph and night-time noise enforcement which we received on 22/10/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Before we can begin to process your FOI Request, we would like to clarify
what information you require.
You have asked: “Could you provide data on how many requests since 20mph
schemes have rolled out across the City of Sheffield have been around cars
speeding in 20mph areas.”
Please can you provide details on what data you are after with a greater
degree of precision. These are our challenges:
We would need to know that a particular road or area was a 20mph area /
zone when the ‘request’ was made. Not all ‘requests’ refer to the
existence of a 20mph area. We could search for 20mph area in emails but
this would also bring up areas where ones were planned and roads where
they are not planned because they are an ‘A’ road.
Speeding enforcement or expressing concern about speeding? If search
emails for speeding concerns it may be really lengthy as there are lots of
words used e.g. ‘flying past’, ‘racing’, ‘racetrack’, ‘driving
dangerously’. The best course would be identifying emails that refer to
20mph areas / zones in operation at the time of the request.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to a
request within 20 working days. The 20 working day clock will start the
day after we receive the necessary clarification.
You can provide your clarification by replying to this email. Please
note, if clarification is not received within 2 months your Freedom of
Information request will be closed.
We look forward to hearing from you.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Mr Little
Thanks for four emails on 19/12/24.
We got four separate requests from you on 22/10/24. The first request
[WDTK: 1189664] at 08:54 was in four parts relating to:
• Harcourt Road parking permits
• Broomhill residents parking area permits
• Requests for 20mph zones relating to cars speeding in those areas
• Night time noise and enforcement officers sent to student HMOs or
properties in the past five years
Your second request at 08:56 [WDTK: 1189666] repeated your request about
the Broomhill residents parking area. We filed it and will not be replying
to it individually.
Your third request at 08:58 [WDTK: 1189668] repeated your request about
20mph zones. We filed it and will not be replying to it individually.
Your fourth request at 09:01 [WDTK: 1189671] repeated your request about
night-time noise and enforcement. We filed it and will not be replying to
it individually.
Your second, third and fourth requests not only duplicated the first
request but are administratively burdensome to treat separately. Each
request would have to be logged separately in our email client Outlook and
our ticketing system; three acknowledgements sent to you; three allocation
emails sent to relevant services; potentially six chasers (at day six and
day 10) and at least three emails in response anticipated.
Our processing of your first request only was also to enable us to
consider whether they were within the “appropriate limit”, which is the
cost specified in the legislation that a public authority can anticipate
have to spend in processing before it could refuse to do so.
We acknowledged your first request on 23/10/24. We wrote to you on
28/10/24 seeking clarification about the 20mph aspect of your first
request. When we seek clarification the 20-day clock stops. You have two
months to respond, or we close it. On 19/12/24 you wrote to us regarding
[WDTK 1189668]. Please accept this email as acknowledgement of the
clarification which you re-worded as follows:
How many requests or reports to the council have there been to tackle
speeding cars within designated 20mph zone areas, and if possible broken
down by 20mph area the report mentions.
We will now continue to deal with this under the Freedom of Information
Act.  The reference number for your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days. The 20-working day clock will start the day after
we receive the necessary clarification. Therefore, you should expect to
receive a response from us by 22/01/2025.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear James Little,
Thank you for your request for information relating to parking permits, 20
mph and night-time noise enforcement. We apologise for the delay in
responding.
Can you please provide the number of parking permits currently issued on
Harcourt Road, S10 Sheffield.
Please indicate:
1) How many resident's parking permits issued - 51
2) How many visitor permit books - 51
3) The number of houses that have 1 residents permit issued - 21
4) The number of houses that have 2 residents permits issued - 15
4) The number of houses that have 3 or more residents permits issued - 0
Can you please provide the number of parking permits currently issued
within the Broomhill residents parking area.
Please indicate:
1) How many resident's parking permits issued - 461
2) How many visitor permit books - 434
3) The number of houses that have 1 residents permit issued - 237
4) The number of houses that have 2 residents permits issued - 109
4) The number of houses that have 3 or more residents permits issued - 2
How many requests or reports to the council have there been to tackle
speeding cars within designated 20mph zone areas, and if possible broken
down by 20mph area the report mentions.
We would have to carry out a manual search of our records. We estimate
that we would need to search 15,000 emails and that it would take 3
minutes to search each case to review if this is applicable. Therefore, it
would take us 750 hours to collate the information, which is more than the
cost limit of 18 hours or £450 specified in the [1]Freedom of Information
and Data Protection (Appropriate Limit and Fees) Regulations 2004 (SI 2004
No. 3244).
Under section 16 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000, we have a duty to
provide advice and assistance to requesters. If you would like to narrow
down the focus of your request, we would be happy to process your revised
request as a new request for information under the Freedom of Information
Act 2000.
How many times have the night-time noise and enforcement team been sent to
student HMOs or properties in the past 5 years in the city of Sheffield.
Information not held. The council does not record HMO data on the system
in this manner.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
